title: AD Spell-Vamp Item
body:
Doesn't it make sense to have a full AD item similar to {{item:3152}} that gives spell-vamp for those AD Casters like {{champion:64}}, {{champion:238}} , {{champion:91}}, etc who want some sustain through their spells?
Although there may not be the largest champ pool who may find use from this kind of item,  I think the more options for item paths the better.

replies.body:
It's called Lifesteal.........

Or am I just trolled?

no I think he means a spell vamp item that physical damage dealers such as {{champion:107}} or {{champion:62}} can use to heal from using their abilities, as opposed to auto-attacks.

Of course, such an item would create some pretty heavy abuse cases since Assassins can pick them up to make themselves a bit tankier in teamfights.

Assassins generally are of hit or miss playstyle, so they mostly spam one rotation and hopefully get some heads flying because drawn out fights render them unable to do pretty much anything once everything is now on cd. So an ad focused spell vamp item tbh while it may be nice but it really won't get much use it because when assassins insta gib somebody they're mostly full hp anyway while in a drawn out fight they can't utilise the advantages due to everything is on cd.

And fighters like Jax, Mundo, Reng and Wukong or melee adcs like Trynd or Yi generally have in-built sustain options like shield/heal or whatever in their kit, so I also don't think an ad focused spell vamp is necessary or remotely useful for them.

It can be nice to have, definitely. But tbh I don't see anyone will find much use from it because it's prob too situational.

However I guess more items into the game is somewhat a good thing to see.

EDIT: Lifesteal procs empowered AA so there's that.
So ad poke champs healing every 3-4 seconds with their ranged nuke skillshots, no thanks.
